title: Apple Park aerial view
description: Apple Inc. is an American multinational technology company headquartered in Cupertino, California, United States

title: Garage of Steve Jobs' parents
description: In 1976, Steve Jobs co-founded Apple in his parents' home on Crist Drive in Los Altos, California. Although it is widely believed that the company was founded in the house's garage, Apple co-founder Steve Wozniak called it a bit of a myth. Jobs and Wozniak did, however, move some operations to the garage when the bedroom became too crowded.

title: Apple 1 On display at the Smithsonian
description: Apple's first product, the Apple I, designed by Steve Wozniak, was sold as an assembled circuit board and lacked basic features such as a keyboard, monitor, and case. The owner of this unit added a keyboard and wooden case.

title: The Apple II Computer
description: The Apple II Plus, introduced in 1979, designed primarily by Wozniak.

title: Cropped, Color adjusted version of Macintosh
description: The Macintosh, released in 1984, is the first mass-market personal computer to feature an integral graphical user interface and mouse.

title: Apple PenLite prototype (1992)
description: The PenLite is Apple's first prototype of a tablet computer. Created in 1992, the project was designed to bring the Mac OS to a tablet â€“ but was canceled in favor of the Newton.
